intro: Galium confertum, commonly known as bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers in late spring to early summer, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Galium confertum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal remedies.
